glsa.title: VDR: Arbitrary file overwriting issue
glsa.synopsis: VDR insecurely accesses files with elevated privileges, which may result in the overwriting of arbitrary files.

background.p: Video Disk Recorder (VDR) is a Linux-based digital video recorder. The VDR program handles the On Screen Menu system that offers complete control over channel settings, timers and recordings.

description.p: Javier Fernandez-Sanguino Pena from the Debian Security Audit Team discovered that VDR accesses user-controlled files insecurely.

impact.p: A local attacker could create malicious links and invoke a VDR recording that would overwrite arbitrary files on the system.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
